title: Congratulating the Clinton Community College Women's Soccer Team upon the occasion of winning the NJCAA's Division III Championship
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  congratulating  the  Clinton  Community College
Women's Soccer Team and Coach Donna Dixon upon the occasion  of  winning
the  National Junior College Athletic Association's Division III Champi-
onship

WHEREAS, Excellence and success in competitive sports  can  be  achieved
only  through strenuous practice, team play and team spirit, nurtured by
dedicated coaching and strategic planning; and
  WHEREAS, Athletic competition enhances the moral and physical develop-
ment of the young people of this State, preparing them for the future by
instilling in them the value of  teamwork,  encouraging  a  standard  of
healthy living, imparting a desire for success and developing a sense of
fair play and competition; and
  WHEREAS,  The  Clinton  Community  College Women's Soccer Team are the
National Junior College  Athletic  Association's  (NJCAA)  Division  III
Champions;  on Sunday, November 7, 2010, the Lady Cougars defeated Gene-
see Community College of Batavia, New York, by a  3-2  score  at  Prince
George Community College in Largo, Maryland; and
  WHEREAS,  The victory for the Clinton Community College Women's Soccer
Team in the New York State final marked the first-ever national  champi-
onship in the history of the school; and
  WHEREAS,  The  athletic  talent displayed by this team is due in great
part to the efforts of Coach Donna Dixon  and  Assistant  Coach  Melanie
Defayette, skilled and inspirational tutors, respected for their ability
to develop potential into excellence; and
  WHEREAS,  The  team's  overall  record of 19-2 is outstanding, and the
team members were loyally  and  enthusiastically  supported  by  family,
fans, friends and the community at large; and
  WHEREAS, The hallmarks of the Clinton Community College Women's Soccer
Team,  from the opening game of the season to participation in the cham-
pionship, were a sisterhood of athletic ability, of good  sportsmanship,
of  honor  and of scholarship, demonstrating that these team players are
second to none; and
  WHEREAS, Athletically and academically, the team members  have  proven
themselves to be an unbeatable combination of talents, reflecting favor-
ably on their school; and
  WHEREAS,  Coach  Donna Dixon has done a superb job in guiding, molding
and inspiring the team members toward their goals; and
  WHEREAS, Sports competition instills the values of teamwork, pride and
accomplishment, and Coach Donna Dixon and the  outstanding  athletes  on
the  Clinton  Community  College Women's Soccer Team have clearly made a
contribution to the spirit of excellence which is a tradition  of  their
school; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
congratulate the Clinton Community  College  Women's  Soccer  Team;  its
members:    Kim Dragoon, Shauni Trombly, Autumn Irwin, Jacqueline Bowen,
Brooke Pray, Lindsay Shine, Molly Bowen, Katie McIntosh,  Brooke  Waite,
Morgan  Roussy,  Kelley  Lucia,  Chelsea  LaRose, Ashley Lamberton, Erin
Sullivan, Codia Holland, Jade Sayward, and Danielle Smith,  and  Coaches
Donna  Dixon and Melanie Defayette on their outstanding season and over-
all team record; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That copies of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the Clinton Community College  Women's  Soccer  Team  and  to
Coaches Donna Dixon and Melanie Defayette.
